required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Efficacy Study Comparing ABT-335 Coadministered With Atorvastatin and Ezetimibe to Atorvastatin Coadministered With Ezetimibe in Subjects With Multiple Abnormal Lipid (Fat) Levels in the Blood
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Randomized, Double-Blind, Prospective Study Comparing the Safety and Efficacy of ABT-335 in Combination With Atorvastatin and Ezetimibe to Atorvastatin in Combination With Ezetimibe in Subjects With Combined (Atherogenic) Dyslipidemia

brief_summary.textblock: The primary purpose of this study is to compare the safety and efficacy of ABT-335 (investigational drug) coadministered with atorvastatin and ezetimibe to atorvastatin coadministered with ezetimibe in subjects with abnormal lipid (fat) levels in the blood.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Median Percent Change in Triglycerides From Baseline to Final Visit
primary_outcome.description: [(Week 12 triglycerides minus baseline triglycerides)/baseline triglycerides] x 100

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Percent Change in High-Density Lipoprotein Cholesterol (HDL-C) From Baseline to Final Visit
primary_outcome.description: [(Week 12 HDL-C minus baseline HDL-C)/baseline HDL-C] x 100

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Percent Change in Apolipoprotein AI (apoAI) From Baseline to Final Visit
secondary_outcome.description: [(Week 12 apoAI minus baseline apoAI)/baseline apoAI] x 100

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Percent Change in Very Low-Density Lipoprotein Cholesterol (VLDL-C) From Baseline to Final Visit
secondary_outcome.description: [(Week 12 VLDL-C minus baseline VLDL-C)/baseline VLDL-C] x 100

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Percent Change in Apolipoprotein CIII (apoCIII) From Baseline to Final Visit
secondary_outcome.description: [(Week 12 apoCIII minus baseline apoCIII)/baseline apoCIII] x 100

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Percent Change in Non-High-Density Lipoprotein Cholesterol (Non-HDL-C) From Baseline to Final Visit
secondary_outcome.description: [(Week 12 non-HDL-C minus baseline non-HDL-C)/baseline non-HDL-C] x 100

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Percent Change in Apolipoprotein B (apoB) From Baseline to Final Visit
secondary_outcome.description: [(Week 12 apoB minus baseline apoB)/baseline apoB] x 100

secondary_outcome.measure: Median Percent Change in High-Sensitivity C-Reactive Protein (hsCRP) From Baseline to Final Visit
secondary_outcome.description: [(Week 12 hsCRP minus baseline hsCRP)/baseline hSCRP] x 100

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects with mixed dyslipidemia (trigylcerides, > or = to 150 mg/dL to < 400 mg/dL; HDL-C < 40 mg/dL for males, < 50 mg/dL for females; LDL-C, > or = to 130 mg/dL).
- Subjects must agree to use adequate birth control methods and to adhere to the American Heart Association (AHA) Diet.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects with unstable or uncontrolled medical conditions considered inappropriate in a clinical trial.
- Subjects with an unstable dose of medications or receiving Coumadin, oral, intravenous or intramuscular cyclosporine, statins, or certain other medications.
- Women who are pregnant or plan on becoming pregnant, or women who are lactating.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: One subject was randomized to the atorvastatin and ezetimibe treatment group and never received study drug.

participants_list.participants: 1 subject was randomized but not treated because of an abnormal ECG that precluded treatment.

outcome.title: Median Percent Change in Triglycerides From Baseline to Final Visit
outcome.description: [(Week 12 triglycerides minus baseline triglycerides)/baseline triglycerides] x 100
outcome.population: All randomized subjects with a baseline triglyceride value and at least 1 postbaseline triglyceride value, last observation carried forward.

measure.title: Median Percent Change in Triglycerides From Baseline to Final Visit
measure.description: [(Week 12 triglycerides minus baseline triglycerides)/baseline triglycerides] x 100
measure.population: All randomized subjects with a baseline triglyceride value and at least 1 postbaseline triglyceride value, last observation carried forward.

analysis.groups_desc: A sample size of 212 per arm provided 90% power and > 99% power with a 2-sided alpha = 0.05 level to detect differences between treatment arms of 6% and 17% in the percent change in HDL-C and TG, respectively, assuming an SD of 19% and 30%, respectively. This sample size provided an overall power of approximately 90% for the 2 primary comparisons. If a loss to follow-up rate of 8% was assumed, the sample size needed to be increased to 230 per arm to maintain the above power.
analysis.p_value_desc: The treatment group comparisons for both primary efficacy variables must have demonstrated superiority of ABT-335 + atorvastatin + ezetimibe to declare this arm successful. Thus, no adjustments were made for multiple comparisons.

outcome.title: Mean Percent Change in Apolipoprotein AI (apoAI) From Baseline to Final Visit
outcome.description: [(Week 12 apoAI minus baseline apoAI)/baseline apoAI] x 100
outcome.population: All randomized subjects with a baseline apoAI value and at least 1 postbaseline apoAI value, last observation carried forward.

measure.title: Mean Percent Change in Apolipoprotein AI (apoAI) From Baseline to Final Visit
measure.description: [(Week 12 apoAI minus baseline apoAI)/baseline apoAI] x 100
measure.population: All randomized subjects with a baseline apoAI value and at least 1 postbaseline apoAI value, last observation carried forward.

analysis.groups_desc: Secondary endpoints were tested in fixed sequence. If superiority of ABT-335 + atorvastatin + ezetimibe treatment was demonstrated for primary endpoints, secondary endpoints were tested in ranked order of apoA1, VLDL-C, apoC3, non-HDL-C, apoB, and hsCRP at alpha = 0.05 level until 1 secondary endpoint failed to reach statistical significance.
analysis.method_desc: Corresponding baseline lipid value as the covariate and with effect for treatment group.

outcome.title: Mean Percent Change in High-Density Lipoprotein Cholesterol (HDL-C) From Baseline to Final Visit
outcome.description: [(Week 12 HDL-C minus baseline HDL-C)/baseline HDL-C] x 100
outcome.population: All randomized subjects with a baseline high density lipoprotein cholesterol (HDL-C) value and at least 1 postbaseline HDL-C value, last observation carried forward.

measure.title: Mean Percent Change in High-Density Lipoprotein Cholesterol (HDL-C) From Baseline to Final Visit
measure.description: [(Week 12 HDL-C minus baseline HDL-C)/baseline HDL-C] x 100
measure.population: All randomized subjects with a baseline high density lipoprotein cholesterol (HDL-C) value and at least 1 postbaseline HDL-C value, last observation carried forward.

analysis.groups_desc: A sample size of 212 per arm provided 90% power and > 99% power with a 2-sided alpha = 0.05 level to detect differences between treatment arms of 6% and 17% in the percent change in HDL-C and TG, respectively, assuming an SD of 19% and 30%, respectively. This sample size provided an overall power of approximately 90% for the 2 primary comparisons. If a loss to follow-up rate of 8% was assumed, the sample size needed to be increased to 230 per arm to maintain the above power.
analysis.p_value_desc: The treatment group comparisons for both primary efficacy variables must have demonstrated superiority of ABT-335 + atorvastatin + ezetimibe to declare this arm successful. Thus, no adjustments were made for multiple comparisons.
analysis.method_desc: Corresponding baseline lipid value as the covariate and with effect for treatment group.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Not to publish or present the results before the publication of the multi-center investigator paper, but in no event shall be so restricted after the expiration of twelve (12) months from completion of the studies at all sites. Any presentation or publication to be submitted to Sponsor (in Draft of the same) for Sponsor review and comment.
